page.title: 01GENERAL FEATURES
page.content:
The area of Rod Moor is covered mainly by moorland with patches of woodland and several grazing fields.The area is not very heavily populated the only village being Dungworth.
People live in isolated farms or clusters of farms, or in recently renovated elderly estate buildings.There is no uniform style of building,other than that they are stone walled and slate rooved. Rod Moor is generally used for sheep and dairy farming though there are several other farming types on arable land. A large sector of the moor is privately owned this making access difficult,sometimes impossible. Rod Moor is very bleak with heather, grass and occasional outcrops of rock.
